text: so as we move forward clinical trials
are becoming more complex and really
some of the key challenges we have are
around recruitment so how do we identify
the right patients how do we know where
they're situated across the globe and
then how do we know which clinical trial
sites are most appropriate to be able to
identify and leverage those patient
populations we're using the Amazon
Bedrock service and by combining text to
SQL and rag we're able to bring together
structured and unstructured data sources
development assistant is a generative AI
application that we've built in
partnership with AWS it allows many
different users across clinical
development and clinical operations to
access unstructured and structured data
sources bring them together and provide
insights within seconds and what this
means for our teams is that they can use
a conversation interface they can ask
natural language questions and be able
to get an output that's meaningful and
importantly has Source information so
they can go back and check the
reliability of the information that is
pulled through what this means to our
patients is really the opportunity to
accelerate our medicines to patients
much quicker our collaboration with AWS
is key to continuing on our journey of
simplifying automating and transforming
the way we work across the development
pipeline for our azed staff for our
sites and for our patients
